sentences.text: General elections were held in Mozambique on 9 October 2024 to elect the List of presidents of Mozambique|president, the 250 members of the Assembly of the Republic (Mozambique)|Assembly of the Republic and members of the ten provincial assemblies.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|title=Mozambique to Hold Presidential Election Oct. 9 Next Year|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-08-04/mozambique-to-hold-presidential-election-oct-9-next-year|website=Bloomberg|date=4 August 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=7 August 2023 |title=Mozambique to Hold General Elections On October 9, Next Year • 360 Mozambique |url=https://360mozambique.com/development/mozambique-to-hold-presidential-election-on-october-9-next-year/ |access-date=12 September 2023 |website=360 Mozambique |language=en-GB}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Mozambique: Presidential, legislative elections scheduled for 9 October 2024 |url=https://clubofmozambique.com/news/mozambique-presidential-legislative-elections-scheduled-for-9-october-2024-242721/ |access-date=12 September 2023 |website=Mozambique |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: The ruling FRELIMO party, which has increasingly become marked with growing concerns of authoritarianism and impunity amid the controversies surrounding the 2023 Mozambican local elections|2023 local elections and the 2019 Mozambican general election|2019 general election, was declared the winner of the election, with its leader, Daniel Chapo, proclaimed as President of Mozambique|president-elect. This was disputed by Venâncio Mondlane, with his party Optimist Party for the Development of Mozambique|PODEMOS claiming Mondlane had received 53% of the vote using data from their poll observers. The result was also questioned by the Episcopal Conference of Mozambique and the European Union, while 2024–2025 Mozambican protests|deadly protests broke out over the election results, with at least 250 deaths, mostly demonstrators being killed by police and army forces.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique: October 9 |url=https://africacenter.org/spotlight/2024-elections/mozambique/ |website=Africa Center for Strategic Studies |access-date=1 April 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique top court confirms ruling party's win in disputed election |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/12/23/mozambique-top-court-confirms-ruling-partys-win-in-disputed-election |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=23 December 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique post-election violence kills 125 in three days: NGO |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20241226-mozambique-post-election-violence-kills-125-in-three-days-ngo |website=France 24 |access-date=27 December 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: The List of presidents of Mozambique|president is elected using the two-round system. The 250 members of the Assembly of the Republic (Mozambique)|Assembly of the Republic are elected by proportional representation in eleven multi-member constituencies based on the country's provinces of Mozambique|provinces and on a first-past-the-post basis from two single-member constituencies representing Mozambican citizens in Africa and Europe. Seats in the multi-member constituencies are allocated using the d'Hondt method, with an electoral threshold of 5%. Official results are announced by the National Election Commission (CNE) after 15 days and must subsequently be validated by the Constitutional Council.<ref name="africa"/>

references.text: <ref>[http://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/2327/ Republic of Mozambique: Election for President (President)] IFES</ref>
<ref>[http://www.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/2223_B.htm Electoral system] IPU</ref>

sentences.text: Concerns have been raised over discrepancies in the total number of registered voters, which stands at more than 17 million. The non-governmental organisation Centro de Integridade Pública, citing data published by the CNE, said that there are 878,868 more registered voters than there are voting age adults in some provinces, leading them to describe 5% of the electorate as "ghost voters". The International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance also notes the existence of "ghost voters" in seven of the country's ten provinces, with up to a third of the registered voting population in Gaza Province believed to be non-existent.<ref name="bbc"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title='We will win!': Mozambique's ruling party confident at final vote rally |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20241006-we-will-win-mozambique-s-ruling-party-confident-at-final-vote-rally |website=France 24 |date=7 October 2024 |access-date=7 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text:
Amélia Muendane, Luísa Diogo, Jaime Basílio Monteiro, José Condungua Pacheco|José Pacheco, Celso Correia, and Samora Machel junior.
On 5 May 2024, after a meeting of its Central Committee, FRELIMO named Daniel Chapo, a 47-year old law professor and former governor of Inhambane Province, as its candidate in the upcoming election to succeed outgoing president Filipe Nyusi. Chapo is the first presidential candidate of FRELIMO who was born after Mozambique gained independence in 1975.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique's ruling party names new leader ahead of elections |url=https://www.africanews.com/2024/05/06/mozambiques-ruling-party-names-new-leader-ahead-of-elections/ |website=Africanews |date=6 May 2024 |access-date=7 May 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="bbc">{{cite web |title=Fresh faces in Mozambique's poll as independence era leaders bow out |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c9qv1nw302ro |website=BBC |date=6 October 2024 |access-date=6 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: On the same date, the Democratic Movement of Mozambique (MDM) selected its leader, Lutero Simango, to be its candidate for the October elections.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique: MDM elects Lutero Simango as its presidential candidate |url=https://clubofmozambique.com/news/mozambique-mdm-elects-lutero-simango-as-its-presidential-candidate-257825/ |website=Club of Mozambique |date=6 May 2024 |access-date=9 May 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Other candidates include Ossufo Momade, the leader of the RENAMO party since 2018 who had lost in the 2019 Mozambican general election|2019 presidential election to Nyusi, and Venâncio Mondlane, a banker and forestry engineer who ran as an independent candidate|independent after breaking away from RENAMO following an unsuccessful bid in the mayoral election in Maputo in 2023 that was marred by allegations of electoral fraud. Mondlane was registered as the PODEMOS party's presidential candidate for this election. Also, the president of the PODEMOS party, Albino Forquilha, said that he allows for the possibility of Mondlane becoming the party leader in the future.

references.text: <ref name="africa">{{cite web |title=Mozambique's presidential election: Here's what to know |url=https://www.africanews.com/2024/10/08/mozambiques-presidential-election-heres-what-to-know/ |website=Africanews |date=8 October 2024 |access-date=8 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="bbc"/> Mondlane was supported by the newly established Optimist Party for the Development of Mozambique (PODEMOS), as well as the Democratic Alliance, a coalition of opposition parties that were barred from contesting the election.<ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique votes for president and the ruling party could extend its 49 years in power |url=https://apnews.com/article/mozambique-election-president-frelimo-chapo-bdcef382aa0462bfdbe8d89ca284b241 |website=Associated Press |date=9 October 2024 |access-date=9 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique's election: Who's contesting and what's at stake? |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/9/mozambiques-election-whos-contesting-and-whats-at-stake |website=Al Jazeera |date=9 October 2024 |access-date=9 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=14 October 2024 |title=Venâncio Mondlane não reconhece possível vitória de Daniel Chapo |url=https://www.rfi.fr/pt/%C3%A1frica-lus%C3%B3fona/20241014-ven%C3%A2ncio-mondlane-n%C3%A3o-reconhece-poss%C3%ADvel-vit%C3%B3ria-de-daniel-chapo |access-date=16 October 2024 |website=RFI |language=pt}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=O país acorda em suspense: Quem irá liderar Moçambique?|date=10 October 2024|url=https://www.dw.com/pt-002/o-pa%C3%ADs-acorda-em-suspense-quem-ir%C3%A1-liderar-mo%C3%A7ambique/a-70451546 |access-date=16 October 2024 |website=dw.com |language=pt}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=SAPO |title=Moçambique. Podemos admite que Venâncio Mondlane se possa tornar líder do partido |url=https://24.sapo.pt/atualidade/artigos/mocambique-podemos-admite-que-venancio-mondlane-se-possa-tornar-lider-do-partido |access-date=16 October 2024 |website=SAPO 24 |language=pt}}</ref>

sentences.text: Campaigning was held from August to 6 October. Chapo was seen as the favorite to win the election. Independent candidate Venâncio Mondlane was seen as the biggest challenge to Chapo.<ref name="aueu" />

references.text: <ref name="delgado"/> Both Chapo and Mondlane also made campaign stops in neighbouring South Africa, appealing to overseas voters there.<ref name="bbc"/> All three candidates named the resolution of the Insurgency in Cabo Delgado as their main priority.<ref name="delgado">{{cite web |title=Mozambique headed for crucial elections amid jihadist insurgency and drought-induced hunger |url=https://apnews.com/article/mozambique-elections-insurgency-drought-cabo-delgado-96a9301e0c1f0333e2d959fae2f7af12 |website=Associated Press|first1=Charles|last1=Mangwiro|first2=Mogomotsi|last2=Magome |date=7 October 2024 |access-date=7 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="Reuters 10-9">{{cite web |last1=Peyton |first1=Nellie |last2=Mucari |first2=Manuel |title=Mozambique ruling party eyes new term as election runs peacefully |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/voting-begins-mozambique-election-likely-see-ruling-party-win-2024-10-09/ |website=Reuters |access-date=9 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Southern African Development Community sent 52 election observers to monitor the election. However, more than 200 polling stations denied journalists and observers access to the vote counting process with the election watchdog group Sala da Paz stating: "There were significant cases of .... electoral irregularities that may raise questions about the credibility of the process."

references.text: <ref name="delgado"/> Observers were also deployed by the African Union and the European Union.<ref name="aueu">{{cite web |title=Mozambique counts votes in its presidential election as opposition alleges fraud |url=https://apnews.com/article/mozambique-election-president-frelimo-chapo-bdcef382aa0462bfdbe8d89ca284b241 |website=Associated Press|first=Charles|last=Mangwiro |date=10 October 2024 |access-date=10 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="Reuters-Fraud">{{cite web |last1=Peyton |first1=Nellie |title=Mozambique counts votes amid allegations of irregularities |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/mozambique-early-vote-counting-under-way-after-peaceful-election-2024-10-10/ |website=Reuters |access-date=14 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Polling opened at 07:00 and closed at 18:00. Chapo's rivals alleged instances of fraud such as ballot boxes being unsealed before voting ended and some of their representatives being denied accreditation to monitor the vote.<ref name="aueu"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Mozambique elects new president in tense vote |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20241009-mozambique-elects-new-president-in-tense-vote |website=France 24 |date=9 October 2024 |access-date=9 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Opposition candidate Venâncio Mondlane preemptively declared himself victor.

references.text: <ref name="Attorney General">{{cite web |title=Mozambique Elections: Attorney-General's Office summons Venâncio Mondlane – AIM |url=https://clubofmozambique.com/news/mozambique-elections-attorney-generals-office-summons-venancio-mondlane-aim-268731/ |website=clubofmozambique.com |access-date=16 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: By 16 October preliminary reports showed Chapo in the lead. On 24 October, the CNE announced that Chapo won the election with 71% of the vote, while turnout was at 43%. It also said that FRELIMO won in all provincial elections and won 195 of the 250 seats in parliament, with PODEMOS winning 31 seats and RENAMO winning 20. PODEMOS disputed the results, publishing their own parallel count from their election monitors which showed Mondlane won with 53% of the vote and the party won 138 seats. PODEMOS provided over 660 pounds of tabulated ballots to support their election count. On 23 December, the Constitutional Council published and validated the election results, which were different from the preliminary outcome announced by the CNE.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |last1=Mucari |first1=Manuel |title=Mozambique ruling party leads early election results as opposition cries foul |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/mozambique-ruling-party-leads-early-election-results-opposition-cries-foul-2024-10-16/ |website=Reuters |access-date=16 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c14lzy75355o|title=Mozambique's ruling party wins landslide in disputed poll|work=BBC News|first1=Danai|last1=Nesta Kupemba|first2= Shingai|last2=Nyoka|date=24 October 2024|access-date=24 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hill |first1=Matthew |title=Mozambican Opposition Leader Warns of New Election Protests |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-10-28/mozambique-eelctions-opposition-leader-warns-of-renewed-protests |website=Bloomberg news |access-date=28 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=Acórdão nº 24/CC/2024 - Validação de Eleições Gerais (Presidencial e dos Deputados da Assembleia da República) e das Assembleias Provinciais e do Governador de Província |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241224082956/https://www5.open.ac.uk/technology/mozambique/sites/www.open.ac.uk.technology.mozambique/files/files/Acordao%2050%202024%20Proclamac%CC%A7a%CC%83o.pdf |website=Constitutional Council |date=22 December 2024 |access-date=28 December 2024 |language=pt}}</ref>

sentences.text:
*{{China}}: Foreign ministry spokesmen Lin Jian congratulated "the Frelimo party and Chapo on their election victory" on 26 October and called for a continuation of strong Chinese-Mozambican ties.
*{{South Africa}}: President Cyril Ramaphosa announced on 27 October that he welcomes the election results and congratulated "President-Elect Daniel Chapo and his party, FRELIMO" while also calling for calm and denouncing violence. After violence broke out related to the election, foreign minister Ronald Lamola expressed concern and called for calm.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=China congratulates Daniel Chapo on election as Mozambique's President |url=https://www.tvcnews.tv/2024/10/china-congratulates-daniel-chapo-on-election-as-mozambiques-president/ |website=TVC News |date=26 October 2024 |access-date=29 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=President Ramaphosa welcomes preliminary General Elections results in Mozambique |url=https://dirco.gov.za/president-ramaphosa-welcomes-preliminary-general-elections-results-in-mozambique/ |website=Department of International Relations and Cooperation |date=27 October 2024 |access-date=29 October 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="border">{{cite web |title=South Africa closes its border again with Mozambique, where post-election violence worsens |url=https://apnews.com/article/mozambique-elections-protests-violence-d0856588349937fa1975032bd3de552f |website=Associated Press |date=7 November 2024 |access-date=7 November 2024}}</ref>
